CARDINAL . Articles DATE and CARDINAL of LAW entitle the police to arrest a person who obstructs the public order and to use direct coercive force LAW “ to accomplish subordination to given orders ” .
A special governmental ordinance of CARDINAL DATE ( ORG ) provides that coercive means should cause as little ailment as possible , and should be abandoned if a person conforms to orders .

Under LAW , an accused may apply to a prosecutor to be appointed a free defence counsel in case of insufficiency of means . The prosecutor must refer the request to the court for a lawyer to be appointed .
Under LAW , in the course of the trial the court may of its own motion appoint a lawyer to represent the defendant in view of the justified concern over his state of mind .
